metadata.title: CVE-2021-23974 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The DOMParser API did not properly process '<noscript>' elements forescaping. This could be used as an mXSS vector to bypass an HTML Sanitizer.This vulnerability affects Firefox < 86.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23974` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 86.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 86.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 86.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '86.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
